intro: Erigeron chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It features slender stems and small, white to pale blue ray flowers surrounding a central disk. Erigeron chiriquensis is often found in the cloud forests and lowland areas of countries like Costa Rica and Panama.
